title: Manchester United  register interest  in Champions League finalist , star favours move to Old Trafford
body_text:
Manchester United are reported to have registered an interest in signing Inter Milan goalkeeper Andre Onana.
Andre Onana played under Erik ten Hag at Ajax, and while the pair had a bumpy ride in their last season, with Onana suspended and then pushing through a move to Inter, that may not put club or player off a move.
According to The Guardian, Manchester United have ‘registered an interest’ in signing Onana from Inter this summer.
The Serie A side are expected to have to sell players due to financial issues.
Andre Onana favours Manchester United move
The Guardian report Andre Onana favours a move to Manchester United over Chelsea, who are also interested.
This could be down to a combination of Ten Hag, and the Red Devils being able to offer Champions League football.
Onana starred in the Champions League final, impressing with his footwork and shot-stopping ability.
Pep Guardiola told his pre-final press conference, “Identifying the space and emptying the midfield is a special quality. Normally, teams have great keepers, but he [Onana] is exceptional with his feet.”
He added after the game that Onana made the game more difficult for his City side.
Onana was excellent in the final in Turkey, and really showed what Manchester United have been lacking, with David de Gea simply not good enough with his feet.
De Gea’s contract has not yet been signed, and even if he does, there is no guarantee he will stay on as first choice.
Onana, 27, is a Cameroon international and also a former teammate of Lisandro Martinez and Antony at Ajax.
The Guardian report Manchester United are also considering a move for Porto’s Diogo Costa, four years younger than Onana at 23.
